result.execSummary:
The defendant Rhonda A. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Harboring/Aiding a Felon (E/F/G/H/I or unclassified felony/not life), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.47(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Count 1 - Harboring/aiding a felon - No contest plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in count 2.   Motion granted.    
Defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for sixty (60) days, under the Huber Law, to commence on 09-30-22 by 6:00 p.m.   
$518.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 11-01-22 or 10 days jail.   Submit DNA sample.   
Minutes.
Plea date on September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Order Modifying Bond Conditions.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's conditions of bond are modified as follows:
1) the defendant may have contact with C.P., except that they may not discuss this case
2) the defendant may not have contact with Robert Keller, except that her attorney may arrange a one time property exchange with law enforcement for her to retrieve her property from Mr. Keller's residence.  Law enforcement does not necessarily have to be present during the exchange, but law enforcement must be made aware of the exchange before it takes place.  Either law enforcement or the defendant's attorney must be present at the property exchange to ensure that Mr. Keller is not at the residence when the defendant is there.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:42 p.m.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  4/22/22, 8:30 a.m.
BAIL MOTION:  Stipulation between parties to allow contact with C.P. only, but cannot discuss the case.
No contact with Robert Keller to remain as ordered.   However, the court does allow the defendant a one-time visit to Robert Keller's place to get her stuff.  This is to be set up through Atty. Biilka and law enforcement.  They will make sure Mr. Keller is not there.  Atty. Bilka is to draft the order.
Minutes.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:08 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Rhonda A. Peterson appeared in court, Attorney John Raymond Bilka appeared in court for Rhonda A. Peterson. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Request and Response Regarding Open Records - emailed 03-07-2022
RE:  Harboring or aiding a felon, on 02-06-22.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 02-14-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts harbor/aiding a felon.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-07-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she is not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior approval of the court and have no contact with Robert Keller and C.P..  This provision includes no contact while any party is in custody.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
